title: Corvallis, Oregon
summary: Corvallis (/kɔːrˈvælɪs/ kor-VAL-iss) is a city and the county seat of Benton County in central western Oregon, United States.[6] It is the principal city of the Corvallis, Oregon Metropolitan Statistical Area, which encompasses all of Benton County.  As of the 2010 United States Census, the population was 54,462.[7] Its population was estimated by the Portland Research Center to be 58,856 in 2019.[8] Corvallis is the location of Oregon State University and Good Samaritan Regional Medical Center. Corvallis is the westernmost city in the contiguous 48 states with a population larger than 50,000.
